basics.name: Puru Samal
basics.summary: I'm an MS candidate at Carnegie Mellon University with a strong foundation in Computer Systems, Machine Learning, and Digital Signal Processing. At CMU, I've honed both theoretical and practical skills, which I aim to leverage in solving complex challenges and driving innovation across these domains.

work.name: Language Technologies Institute, Carnegie Mellon University
work.position: Graduate Teaching Assistant | 11-785: Introduction to Deep Learning
work.summary: PyTorch, MLPs, CNNs, RNNs, Transformers, VAEs, Diffusion Models, GANs, ASR, Facial Recognition and Verification
highlights: Supported CMU's flagship deep learning course.
Led the charge on the course's reverse-mode automatic diffrentiation library leading to PuruTorch (see Projects).
Taught students through weekly recitations, weekend hackathons, Piazza Q&A forum, and weekly office hours.

work.name: Computer Science Department, Carnegie Mellon University
work.position: Graduate Teaching Assistant | 15-622: Introduction to Computer Music
work.summary: Audio/Music Signal Processing, Sound Synthesis Algorithms, Digital Audio Effects Processing
highlights: Taught students through weekly office hours, Piazza Q&A forum, and exam review sessions.

work.name: Spatial Experiences Lab and Auditory Lab, Carnegie Mellon University
work.summary: Wavefield Synthesis, Array Signal Processing, Networking, OSC Protocol
highlights: Developed and implemented a 64-channel Wavefield Synthesis system, integrating high-precision audio signal processing with real-time control over spatial audio playback.
Quantified system performance through custom implementations of position-based Direction of Arrival (DOA) and Room Impulse Response (RIR) estimation algorithms.

Designed Sound-Hologram (see Projects), a robust networked framework that abstracted low-level complexities such as file I/O operations, UDP bitstream parsing, multi-threaded inter-device communication, and real-time audio data synchronization across multiple machines into simple primitives.

The system enabled seamless control of audio hardware, providing researchers a simplified shell-like interface for conducting complex highly-customizable multi-subject experiments, all while ensuring high reliability.

education.area: Music and Technology (conc. Computer Systems, Signal Processing and Machine Learning)

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
